topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I am pleased to see that we are in broad agreement, in particular on the need to move away from annual decision-making allowing for a more gradual approach and for better planning by the sector. A longer-term approach will also allow for more stability and sustainability in the exploitation of fisheries resources.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I fear that, far from reducing the levels of discarded catch, critical flaws in the model may cause over-exploitation, as the underlying assumptions used for calculating levels of catch are based on single-species, shallow-water fisheries and do not take account of geographic and biological diversity.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Congratulations to the rapporteur and the Commission on meeting a requirement and corresponding to an objective, however the debate shows a slow response to the scale of challenges facing us.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: We cannot base our actions solely on the blind application of the maximum sustainable yield concept but instead need to check where it succeeded and failed.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: If so, it may well be that some people will say, 'well, Parliament has called on the Commission to look again at its proposals'. I would not like that public relations gesture to be made; I want the Commission to know that there are at least some MEPs who thoroughly disagree with what is being proposed here.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
target_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: It should be noted that FMSY, which is the fishing mortality rate, should not be confused with MSY, which is the catch level.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

target_argument.argument_text: In this case I will make a rare exception.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Outdated models and ecologial concepts demonstrate the desire for further EU competences.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Les pêches ne sont pas la PAC mais un problème insoluble car les stocks de poissons sont limités et la demande est constante ; par conséquent, la politique des pêches n'est pas celle de la PAC.
target_argument.speaker: Jean-Claude Martinez,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

target_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
target_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: Outdated models and ecologial concepts demonstrate the desire for further EU competences.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Les pêches ne sont pas la PAC mais un problème insoluble car les stocks de poissons sont limités et la demande est constante ; par conséquent, la politique des pêches n'est pas celle de la PAC.
target_argument.speaker: Jean-Claude Martinez,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: Madam President, with just one minute to speak, I have been asked to take the floor on behalf of Polish fishermen, who wish to state that the regulation that has been introduced concerning a ban on cod fishing discriminates against Polish fishermen, especially in view of the widespread knowledge concerning other countries' catches.
target_argument.speaker: Urszula Krupa (IND/DEM).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: We should not get too sidetracked by discussing the technicalities of what MSY actually is and how it should be applied, but rather bring fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

target_argument.argument_text: Few of us will dispute the importance of having long-term sustainability of commercial fish stocks.

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: A more important focus is bringing fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...

target_argument.argument_text: We entered into a commitment to conserve fish stocks and restore them rapidly to the level which ensures maximum sustainable yield. topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
source_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

target_argument.argument_text: The European Union needs a flexible system to manage fish stocks and the facilities to react quickly. There also needs to be provision in the long-term plans for reasonable yet flexible yearly adjustments.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: I am pleased to see that we are in broad agreement, in particular on the need to move away from annual decision-making allowing for a more gradual approach and for better planning by the sector. A longer-term approach will also allow for more stability and sustainability in the exploitation of fisheries resources.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: The European Union needs a flexible system to manage fish stocks and the facilities to react quickly. There also needs to be provision in the long-term plans for reasonable yet flexible yearly adjustments.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Les pêches ne sont pas la PAC mais un problème insoluble car les stocks de poissons sont limités et la demande est constante ; par conséquent, la politique des pêches n'est pas celle de la PAC.
target_argument.speaker: Jean-Claude Martinez,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Madam President, with just one minute to speak, I have been asked to take the floor on behalf of Polish fishermen, who wish to state that the regulation that has been introduced concerning a ban on cod fishing discriminates against Polish fishermen, especially in view of the widespread knowledge concerning other countries' catches.
target_argument.speaker: Urszula Krupa (IND/DEM).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: We should not get too sidetracked by discussing the technicalities of what MSY actually is and how it should be applied, but rather bring fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Few of us will dispute the importance of having long-term sustainability of commercial fish stocks.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: A more important focus is bringing fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: We entered into a commitment to conserve fish stocks and restore them rapidly to the level which ensures maximum sustainable yield. The change to the administrative system which is being planned sets considerably more ambitious objectives as compared to the current safe level and the precautionary principle. However, the pros and cons of the change must be weighed up very carefully.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: The European Union needs a flexible system to manage fish stocks and the facilities to react quickly. There also needs to be provision in the long-term plans for reasonable yet flexible yearly adjustments.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: This approach should be adaptive so that as we learn more – or, as environmental and ecosystem conditions change – new knowledge can be applied to the approach.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.

source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE), rapporteur. – (ES) Madam President, allow me to say, first of all, that today a Spanish fishing boat sank off the Andalusian coast and as a result three people died and five are currently missing. I ask Parliament to stand with the families in their sorrow and the desire for the missing sailors to be rescued.
target_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: The first thing that I would like to point out, as the Commission itself recognises and Parliament has stated on numerous occasions, is the clear failure of the Community fisheries management system...
target_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: This is the context in which we have received the Commission communication, which opts for maximum sustainable yield as the yardstick for long-term fishing activities...
target_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
target_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: I am pleased to see that we are in broad agreement, in particular on the need to move away from annual decision-making allowing for a more gradual approach and for better planning by the sector. A longer-term approach will also allow for more stability and sustainability in the exploitation of fisheries resources.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: I fear that, far from reducing the levels of discarded catch, critical flaws in the model may cause over-exploitation, as the underlying assumptions used for calculating levels of catch are based on single-species, shallow-water fisheries and do not take account of geographic and biological diversity.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Congratulations to the rapporteur and the Commission on meeting a requirement and corresponding to an objective, however the debate shows a slow response to the scale of challenges facing us.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: We cannot base our actions solely on the blind application of the maximum sustainable yield concept but instead need to check where it succeeded and failed.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: If so, it may well be that some people will say, 'well, Parliament has called on the Commission to look again at its proposals'. I would not like that public relations gesture to be made; I want the Commission to know that there are at least some MEPs who thoroughly disagree with what is being proposed here.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
target_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
target_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

source_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
source_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

target_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: Les pêches ne sont pas la PAC mais un problème insoluble car les stocks de poissons sont limités et la demande est constante ; par conséquent, la politique des pêches n'est pas celle de la PAC.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: Madam President, with just one minute to speak, I have been asked to take the floor on behalf of Polish fishermen, who wish to state that the regulation that has been introduced concerning a ban on cod fishing discriminates against Polish fishermen, especially in view of the widespread knowledge concerning other countries' catches.
target_argument.speaker: Urszula Krupa (IND/DEM).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: We should not get too sidetracked by discussing the technicalities of what MSY actually is and how it should be applied, but rather bring fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.

target_argument.argument_text: We entered into a commitment to conserve fish stocks and restore them rapidly to the level which ensures maximum sustainable yield. target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.

source_argument.argument_text: I fear that, far from reducing the levels of discarded catch, critical flaws in the model may cause over-exploitation, as the underlying assumptions used for calculating levels of catch are based on single-species, shallow-water fisheries and do not take account of geographic and biological diversity.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: We entered into a commitment to conserve fish stocks and restore them rapidly to the level which ensures maximum sustainable yield. The change to the administrative system which is being planned sets considerably more ambitious objectives as compared to the current safe level and the precautionary principle. However, the pros and cons of the change must be weighed up very carefully.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: I fear that, far from reducing the levels of discarded catch, critical flaws in the model may cause over-exploitation, as the underlying assumptions used for calculating levels of catch are based on single-species, shallow-water fisheries and do not take account of geographic and biological diversity.
source_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

target_argument.argument_text: The European Union needs a flexible system to manage fish stocks and the facilities to react quickly. There also needs to be provision in the long-term plans for reasonable yet flexible yearly adjustments.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
source_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
source_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.

target_argument.argument_text: Congratulations to the rapporteur and the Commission on meeting a requirement and corresponding to an objective, however the debate shows a slow response to the scale of challenges facing us.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: Madam President, with just one minute to speak, I have been asked to take the floor on behalf of Polish fishermen, who wish to state that the regulation that has been introduced concerning a ban on cod fishing discriminates against Polish fishermen, especially in view of the widespread knowledge concerning other countries' catches.
target_argument.speaker: Urszula Krupa (IND/DEM).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: We should not get too sidetracked by discussing the technicalities of what MSY actually is and how it should be applied, but rather bring fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: Few of us will dispute the importance of having long-term sustainability of commercial fish stocks.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. target_argument.argument_text: A more important focus is bringing fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: We entered into a commitment to conserve fish stocks and restore them rapidly to the level which ensures maximum sustainable yield. The change to the administrative system which is being planned sets considerably more ambitious objectives as compared to the current safe level and the precautionary principle. However, the pros and cons of the change must be weighed up very carefully.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!
source_argument.speaker: Carl Schlyter,

target_argument.argument_text: The European Union needs a flexible system to manage fish stocks and the facilities to react quickly. There also needs to be provision in the long-term plans for reasonable yet flexible yearly adjustments.
target_argument.speaker: Marianne Mikko (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: However, paradoxically, the management system is the only one that was not a fundamental part of the major reforms of 2002 and, because of this, the Commission has to paper over the cracks here and there, dealing with unsustainable discards, inventing control measures day after day and establishing recovery plans...
target_argument.speaker: Carmen Fraga Estévez (PPE-DE),

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I am pleased to see that we are in broad agreement, in particular on the need to move away from annual decision-making allowing for a more gradual approach and for better planning by the sector. A longer-term approach will also allow for more stability and sustainability in the exploitation of fisheries resources.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: We should start to move in the right direction and progressively evaluate and review the MSY reference points as fisheries develop.
target_argument.speaker: Joe Borg,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: The year 2015 is a political date, not a scientific one. It is too early for some stocks and is too late for others in the context of overfishing.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I fear that, far from reducing the levels of discarded catch, critical flaws in the model may cause over-exploitation, as the underlying assumptions used for calculating levels of catch are based on single-species, shallow-water fisheries and do not take account of geographic and biological diversity.
target_argument.speaker: Avril Doyle,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: Congratulations to the rapporteur and the Commission on meeting a requirement and corresponding to an objective, however the debate shows a slow response to the scale of challenges facing us.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: We cannot base our actions solely on the blind application of the maximum sustainable yield concept but instead need to check where it succeeded and failed.
target_argument.speaker: Paulo Casaca,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: If so, it may well be that some people will say, 'well, Parliament has called on the Commission to look again at its proposals'. I would not like that public relations gesture to be made; I want the Commission to know that there are at least some MEPs who thoroughly disagree with what is being proposed here.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I look at one paragraph in particular: ‘Considers that the time is not ripe to propose the introduction of a maximum sustainable yield [MSY] system’. Apparently, we need more analysis. So, while the Commission wants plans, we simply want more talk about plans.
target_argument.speaker: Chris Davies,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: Fish are dying! When they die, there will be no income for fisherman. So it is much smarter to invest in the future by having maximum sustainable yields now, rather than a maximum available yield, which has been the Union's policy so far. That is entirely unsustainable!

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: We have had years of talk about sustainable fisheries, and as many years of bureaucratic controls. Yet stocks in the main are no better, and fishermen are a lot fewer and a lot poorer. It is hard to escape the conclusion that fisheries policy to date has indeed been a hopeless failure.
target_argument.speaker: Jim Allister (NI). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: Madam President, with just one minute to speak, I have been asked to take the floor on behalf of Polish fishermen, who wish to state that the regulation that has been introduced concerning a ban on cod fishing discriminates against Polish fishermen, especially in view of the widespread knowledge concerning other countries' catches.
target_argument.speaker: Urszula Krupa (IND/DEM).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: In order to formulate the maximum sustainable yield objective, it is essential to apply scientific analysis to determine the fishing mortality rate that guarantees the maximum catch which the fisheries resources can provide in a sustainable manner.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: We should not get too sidetracked by discussing the technicalities of what MSY actually is and how it should be applied, but rather bring fishing opportunities into better balance with available stocks for a more sustainable future.
target_argument.speaker: Catherine Stihler (PSE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I think, therefore, Commissioner, that one of the main problems that this Communication raises is that, as it seeks to take action on resources, only restricting fishing activity without placing obligations on the other economic players with activities associated with the marine ecosystem, it loses, and we all lose, political legitimacy, especially as the Commission Directorate responsible for fisheries is also responsible for maritime affairs.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: Different values have been proposed for fishing mortality rates for the long-term management of stocks in the Member States' exclusive economic zones.
source_argument.speaker: Pedro Guerreiro,

target_argument.argument_text: I have not always agreed with our rapporteur, Ms Fraga Estévez, but much of this report I can agree with. It says the Community system has made controls difficult and encouraged discards. It says it welcomes the Commission’s communication recognising that the existing fisheries management policy has failed. It notes that it will be difficult to apply the maximum sustainable yield model to multi-species fisheries, which certainly applies to most that Scots fishermen are involved in. It notes that the model is unsuitable for pelagic species.
target_argument.speaker: Ian Hudghton (Verts/ALE). –

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

target_argument.argument_text: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE) – (ES) Madam President, I think that it is very late, we are all very tired and I think a little shocked by this terrible news of the death of three fishermen and the loss of five more in the waters of Cádiz – the boat belonged to the Barbate fleet – and I think that news like this should make us all think, as it demonstrates the difficulties of an occupation which, even today, can carry off eight men at a single stroke.
target_argument.speaker: Rosa Miguélez Ramos (PSE).

topic: Sustainability in EU fisheries through maximum sustainable yield (debate)

source_argument.argument_text: It should be noted that FMSY, which is the fishing mortality rate, should not be confused with MSY, which is the catch level.
